desc: Picsat receives a message (10 chars) and replies with the same message
name: echo

desc: Manually load the l1 level
name: loadL1
param: a Gericos parameter of l1AppDefine() named `param`, usage: a complete mystery

desc: Triggers transmission of all l0 HK
name: getL0Hk
param: part of the L0 HK to get (part1 or part2)

desc: gets the RTC date (unix time in seconds)
name: getRtc

desc: Sets the RTC date (unix time in seconds) and resets the cpuTickCount to prevent bugs on timeTag values
name: setRtc
param: posix time (unix), in secs since 1 Jan 1970

desc: count the number of fram log entries (using the sdram log copy), with funErrCode between funErrMin and funErrMax included, and with fileCrcCode = fileCrc
name: countFramLogEntries
param: minimum function err code for search (entire int16 range is allowed: -32,768 to 32,767)
maximum function err code for search (entire int16 range is allowed:-32,768 to 32,767)
if set to 0, any CRC is accepted

desc: Use I2C to forward a commad to a subsystem, directly on the I2C address
name: i2cWrite

desc: Use I2C to forward a commad to a subsystem, directly on the I2C address, then reads I2C after a delay and emits the reply in a telemetry
name: i2cWriteRead
param: write => read vTaskDelay in number of ticks

desc: Soft reboot OBC
name: softRebootObc

desc: Hard reboot OBC
name: hardRebootObc

desc: Soft reboot EPS
name: softRebootEps

desc: Hard reboot EPS
name: hardRebootEps

desc: Kicks the Eps dedicated watchdog (P>1h, 1 kick on each pass recommanded)
name: kickEpsDedicatedWatchdog

desc: emits the last nEntries logEntries in the fram log
name: emitLastFramLogEntries

desc: re-emits the last nEntries events preivously reported
name: emitLastEventReports

desc: emits an test event report frame with the error code (EC_baseTestErrorCode = 1000)+errorCodeOffset
name: emitTestEventReport

desc: adds a test entry into the fram log with the error code (EC_baseTestErrorCode = 1000)+errorCodeOffset
name: logFramLogTestEntry

desc: for all available different numerical types, onboard printf of the param values.Return as data the values of each param (endianess conversions check)
name: paramDataValueCheck

desc: initialize the sd cards file system. Also takes care of the physical powering/initialization of the sd cards (init step 1)
name: sdCardsForceFileSystemInit

desc: initialize the sd cards file system if not already initialized. Also takes care of the physical powering/initialization of the sd cards (init step 1)
name: sdCardsFileSystemInit

desc: initialize the file system on the selected sd card (init step 2)
name: sdCardInitVolume

desc: format the selected partition in the active sd card (defined at the sdCardInitVolume step)
name: sdCardFormat
param: current formatiing allow only one parition (=> partitionSelect = 0)

desc: file test on the selected sd card: creates / writes / reads / deletes a test file
name: sdCardFileTest

desc: resends the last 3 execution acknowledges
name: getLast3AckExec

desc: sets the value of the uint8 fram flag identified by index
name: setUint8L0Flag

desc: returns the value of the uint8 fram flag identified by index
name: getUint8L0Flag

desc: sets the FRAM flag area to 0xFF, this also sets all the flag values to their default values
name: resetAllFramFlags

desc: clears fram log entirely, all values are set of 0xFF (~30 sec exec time)
name: clearFramLog

desc: clears fram log counter values, all values are set of 0xFF (~3 sec exec time). Fram log should be considered empty aftre this command.
name: clearFramLogCounters

desc: Stop the execution of all dumps running in background
name: abortAllDumps

desc: Triggers transmission of the norflash content between start_address and start_address+bytes_number to ground for verification (for patching)Return telemetry: data dumped
name: StartDumpNorflashRange

desc: Triggers transmission of the FRAM content between start_address and start_address+bytes_numberReturn telemetry: data dumped
name: StartDumpFram

desc: Triggers transmission of the SDRAM content between start_address and start_address+bytes_number to ground for verification. Can be used to check any variable value or buffer value with it's address from map.txtReturn telemetry: data dumped
name: StartDumpAnySdramRange

desc: Triggers transmission of the SDCard Primary L1 image content between start_address and start_address+bytes_numberto ground for verification (for patching)Return telemetry: data dumped
name: StartDumpSdCardL1PriRange

desc: Triggers transmission of the SDCard Secondary L1 image content between start_address and start_address+bytes_numberto ground for verification (for patching)Return telemetry: data dumped
name: StartDumpSdCardL1SecRange

desc: Write the SDRAM content on any adress between start_address and start_address+bytes_number.Can be used to modify any variable value or buffer value with it's adress from map.txt
name: writeAnySdramRange

desc: Write the FRAM content between start_address and start_address+bytes_numberWith a maximum data size of 212 bytes in a frame, the worst execution time will be around 300 ms
name: writeFramRange

desc: Compute the CRC32 on norflash content between start_address and start_address+bytes_number to ground for verification (for patching)Returns Telemetry: CRC32
name: computeCrc32OnNorflashRange

desc: Compute the CRC32 on any SDRAM adress between start_address and start_address+bytes_number to ground for verification (example: Check that a class is properly loaded)Returns Telemetry: CRC32
name: computeCrc32OnAnySdramRange

desc: Compute the CRC32 on SDCard Primary L1 image content between start_address and start_address+bytes_number to ground for verification (for patching)Returns Telemetry: CRC32
name: computeCrc32OnL1SdPriRange
param: TargetAddress of L1 image on SDCard; 0 Start at &l1AppDefine

desc: Compute the CRC32 on SDCard Secondary L1 image content between start_address and start_address+bytes_numberto ground for verification (for patching)Returns Telemetry: CRC32
name: computeCrc32OnL1SdSecRange
param: TargetAddress of L1 image on SDCard; 0 Start at &l1AppDefine

desc: Compute the CRC32 on WHOLE L1 image for selected L1 source.This is used by ground segment for verification (check correct application of patch, and also check "version" of L1 currently loaded on satellite)Returns Telemetry: CRC32
name: computeCurrentL1Crc32
param: L1 Image starts from &l1AppDefine to SDCARDMAXL1FILESIZE , unused space above L1 padded with ZEROSNORFLASH = 0x01,SDCARD_PRI = 0x02,SDCARD_SEC = 0x03,

desc: Get the expected CRC32 value of L1 for selected L1 source.This value is checked before allowing to load L1 on boot.This value is stored in FRAM.Returns Telemetry: CRC32
name: getFramExpectedL1Crc32
param: L1 Image starts from &l1AppDefine to SDCARDMAXL1FILESIZE , unused space above L1 padded with ZEROS.NORFLASH = 0x01,SDCARD_PRI = 0x02,SDCARD_SEC = 0x03,

desc: Set the expected CRC32 of L1 for selected L1 source.This value is checked before allowing to load L1 on boot.This value is stored in FRAM.
name: setFramExpectedL1Crc32
param: L1 Image starts from &l1AppDefine to SDCARDMAXL1FILESIZE , unused space above L1 padded with ZEROS.NORFLASH = 0x01,SDCARD_PRI = 0x02,SDCARD_SEC = 0x03,

desc: Initialize a L1 patch session and set the number of memory segments contained in the patch. The maximum allowed number of segments is 1024This function shall be called first before patching any memory segment
name: startPatch
param: Total number of segments in the patch

desc: Send a memory segment to patch L1 between start_address and start_address+bytes_numberNote: This function only stores the memory segment in a SDRAM buffer when pushed. The effective writing in norflash will be performed by the command: WritePatchToNORFlashThe maximum size of data in Segment is 230 bytes
name: pushMemSegment
param: Adress to be patched. Reference: 0=first byte of.bin file.Only adresses of L1 area are allowed to be patched.So the allowed patch adress range is: &l1AppDefine in .bin file until&l1AppDefine in .bin file + SDCARDMAXL1FILESIZE(1024*1024)

desc: Get the status of patch sessionReturn telemetry
name: getPatchState

desc: Get the list of segments ID currently received by the satelliteReturn telemetry
name: getListIdReceivedSegments

desc: Get the list of segments ID missing to perform the patch.Return telemetry
name: getListIdMissingSegments

desc: This function perform the writing of L1 image on source passed as parameter of the previously uploaded memory segmentsRun condition: If all segments are received and CRC32 on datas valid
name: validateAndWritePatch
param: The expectedCrc32 is computed on the entire L1 image, starting from l1AppDefine, until l1AppDefine+sizeMaxL1SdCard

desc: Copy L1 image from NORFlash to SdCardPri image file
name: copyNorFlashToSdCardPri

desc: Copy L1 image from NORFlash to SdCardSec image file
name: copyNorFlashToSdCardSec

desc: Copy L1 image from SdCardPri to SdCardSec image file
name: copySdCardPriToSec

desc: Copy L1 image from SdCardSec to SdCardPri image file
name: copySdCardSecToPri

desc: on/off switch for the ADCS 5V power line (gomeps_channel_0)
name: adcsPowerSwitch

desc: sends a command containing "writeData" to the adcs via I2C, returns a TM with the reply from the ADCS on the I2C (readData)
name: sendAdcsCmd

desc: puts the adcs into detumbling mode
name: adcsStartDetumble

desc: stops the detumbling
name: adcsStopDetumble

desc: overwrites norflash memory from address=l1AppDefine to the maximum address with 0's
name: resetNorflashL1

desc: Get the solar temperatures. This command is not affected by the l0HkSpEnable flag
name: getSolarPanelTemps

desc: Creates an empty SDCard 1MB image file for L1 image or ADCS image or payload image.If the image file already exists, it is replaced by a 1MB file filled with zeroes .This is same behaviour as c.resetNorflashL1() but for L1 image file on SDCard
name: createSdCardFile
emitBootError
desc: Emits the content of globalStruct.bootError, which contains all system init errors that occurred during boot

name: forceAntsDeploy
param: 0: sideA / 1: sideB. Side A and B are redundant, and using either shuld have the same effect. In case you are in the dire situation where you need this command, this is a chance parameter. Two telecommands with 0/1 parameter values can be sent successively.
duration of burn in seconds for ant1 (0 sec=deactivated)
duration of burn in seconds for ant2 (0 sec=deactivated)
duration of burn in seconds for ant3 (0 sec=deactivated)
duration of burn in seconds for ant4 (0 sec=deactivated)
desc: Forced deployment of ants systems (override deploy ISIS function), of all antennas
